result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick C. Domka in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Derrick C. Domka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-467, 15CM-12, 14CF-348 and 14CF-469.

4:20 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Parties anticipate doing the plea only today, argued sentencing and PSI.

14CF-348: State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1.
Defendant will plead to amended charge. Counts 2, 3, and 4 would be dismissed and rad in
14CF-467: Defendant will plead to Count 1 as charged. Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 would be dismissed and read in
14CF-469: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in
15CM-12: Would be dismissed and read in.

Atty Kryshak concurs.

Defendant has received a copy of the amended information in 14CF-348.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant waives reading of information.

Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-348 Count 1
Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-467 Count 1
Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-469 Count 1

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Court takes a moment to review the complaints.
Defendant acknowledges previous convictions for retail theft.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-348: Count 1: 943.32(1)(a)  939.05
14CF-348: Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-467: Count 1: 943.10(1)(a)  939.62(1)(c)
14CF-467: Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-469: Count 1: 943.23(2)  939.62(1)(b)
14CF-469: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-12: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the PSI. 
Sentencing will be scheduled after 60 days.
and Invoice from Behavioral Consultants /s/JVF 07-07-15 - Original filed in 14CF348
from Behavioral Consultants, Inc. - Mental Health Evaluation dated 06-22-15 - original filed in 14CF348

Defendant Derrick C. Domka in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Derrick C. Domka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF348, 14CF467, 14CF469 and 15CM12.
Attorney is addressing the NGI of defendant.

10:29 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen states that the defendant had made an NGI plea on May 4, 2015.
Defendant does not meet the NGI requirements per the examination completed.
Atty Kryshak requests the NGI plea to be withdrawn
Plea/Sentencing date to be set in August.

BY THE COURT:
NGI plea is withdrawn.

Defendant Derrick C. Domka in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Derrick C. Domka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF348, 15CM12, 14CF467, 14CF469

3:47 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Kryshak makes statements.  His client would like to enter NGI plea to all cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the pleas.  Atty Kryshak is to contact the Judicial Assistant tomorrow.
Status conference on June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

12/22/14: Bond amended to include that this bond 14CF467 now cover , 14CF468 and 14CF469 with the conditions remaining the same:
No contact with Larry Flatoff or his residence. 
No contact with Amy Hageness. 
No contact with Crystal Domka.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court.  Defendant Derrick C. Domka appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF467, 14CF468, 14CF469

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Court reviews the file in regards to bond. Bond was set in 14CF467 only. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued in 14CF467. 

Atty Constable moves to amend the complaint in 14CF467.  Count 6 should be amended to Count 5. 
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.  The bond in 14CF467 will also apply to 14CF468 and 14CF469 along with the respective conditions. State of Wisconsin.
